bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to the Chief of Finance, U.S. Army, November 23, 1926

div1.p: Kean requests the addresses of Mabel Lazear and Jennie Carroll.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to the Chief of Finance, U.S. Army, November 23, 1926
div1.opener:
II
23 November, 1926.
To: Chief of Finance, U.S. Army,
div1.p:
Subject: Addresses of Mrs. Jesse W. Lazear and
Mrs. James Carroll.

It is requested that I be given the present
addresses of Mrs. Jesse W. Lazear and Mrs. James Carroll,
the widows of two members of the Walter Reed Yellow Fever
Commission. They are in receipt of annuities from the
government appropriated on the appropriation bills for
the War Department.
div1.closer:
J. R. KEAN
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retired.
